I've run some tests with vulcan turrets set to limited range (1 to 2 degrees in each axis). Cannon fire has become noticeably more effective; dogfights tend to last about 4 minutes or so until a wing or engine is shot off. I think the best way to incorporate this into a future competition would be to allow turrets to have a total of 3 to 5 degrees of range that they can distribute between the three axis BD armory lets you tweak (for example, 2 degrees of positive pitch + 1 degree of negative pitch + 2 degrees of yaw = 5 degrees total).

I'll try to record some of my test matches tomorrow.
Or what we could do is enable legacy targeting after the planes run out of missiles.

But would it be a little unfair to the plane that runs out of missiles first? Because in the older versions, they can just switch to the guns and continue, but now they need to wait until the other plane runs out of missile. Before that happens, the first plane cannot defend itself effectively.
Better than how we have it now so that missiles either miss and it becomes a fuel fight or he is completely destroyed. Or, I could set a time for guns to go on.
Yea...you're right. We don't actually have a good solution,either a missile fight or a gun fight.

from now on, in gun duels, I will use legacy targeting to stop the fuel running out issue after 5 minutes of nothing.
